IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: MILLBROOK SCHOOL IS a COEDUCATIONAL, COLLEGE PREPARATORY School which offers college preparatory education to its boarding and day students.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MILLBROOK SCHOOL IS A SMALL, COEDUCATIONAL, COLLEGE PREPARATORY BOARDING SCHOOL WHERE CLOSE, NURTURING, AND STIMULATING RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN STUDENTS AND THEIR TEACHERS HAVE BEEN THE SCHOOL'S HALLMARK SINCE ITS FOUNDING. OUR GOAL IS TO PROMOTE IN EACH STUDENT THE INTELLECTUAL, EMOTIONAL, SPIRITUAL, AND PHYSICAL GROWTH WHICH WILL LEAD TO A LIFE BOTH INDIVIDUALLY SATISFYING AND VALUABLE TO THE GREATER SOCIETY.
IRS990.Desc: INDEPENDENT SECONDARY EDUCATION FOR APPROXIMATELY 315 BOARDING AND DAY STUDENTS.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: assistant to the headmaster for external affairs
assistant to the headmaster, Dean of Students

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School has a collection of artwork, recorded at $254,308, which is on public display throughout its campus buildings. The School follows a policy of capitalizing the collection of artwork in its financial statements. Accordingly, collection items are recognized as assets, whether they are purchased or received as a contribution.
THE ART COLLECTIONS GENERALLY REPRESENTS PAINTINGS, pictures, and sculptures THAT HAVE BEEN RECEIVED AS DONATIONS. THEY ARE DISPLAYED AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE CAMPUS.

Income from the School's endowment is appropriated for student financial aid, teacher's salaries and benefits, and operating expenses of the School. Appropriations are made in accordance with donor restrictions, and the School's approved spending policy.

The School has no unrecognized tax benefits at June 30, 2016 and 2015. The School's Federal information returns prior to fiscal year 2013 are closed and management continually evaluates expiring statutes of limitations, audits, proposed settlements, changes in tax law and new authoritative rulings. If the School had unrelated business income taxes, it would recognize interest and penalties associated with any tax matters as part of the income tax provision and include accrued interest and penalties with the related tax liability in the statement of financial position.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: GRANTS REPRESENT FINANCIAL AID PROVIDED TO STUDENTS BASED UPON NEED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Financial aid is offered to qualified students on the basis of the demonstrated financial need of the family and the availability of funds. The School subscribes to the School and Student Services (SSS). SSS assesses a family's financial need by taking the detailed financial information supplied by the family and applying it to a formula nationally accepted by independent schools. SSS then prepares a Report of Family Contribution (RFC), which it sends to the School with a recommendation as to the amount which the family can contribute toward their child's education. The School's Financial Aid Committee will use this recommendation as a starting point for determining a family's award, bearing in mind that there are many special conditions surrounding each family's financial situation. The Financial Aid Committee also takes into account a family's financial strength relative to all of the families who are applying for aid as well as the availability of funds which the school has budgeted for this purpose.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: assistant to the headmaster for exte

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MOST FACULTY MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS. ACCORDINGLY, THE SCHOOL PROVIDES HOUSING TO ALL ELIGIBLE FACULTY MEMBERS BASED ON AVAILABILITY. IN ADDITION, PER THE TERMS OF THE EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENTS THE FOLLOWING BENEFITS ARE AVAILABLE and included as other reportable compensation: A) A HOUSING ALLOWANCE FOR REIMBURSEMENT OF EXPENSES RELATED TO A PERSONAL RESIDENCE B) MEMBERSHIP TO SOCIAL CLUBS (PAID FOR DIRECTLY BY THE SCHOOL)

During calendar year 2015, Mr. Casertano participated in a deferred compensation plan, subject to substantial risk of forfeiture, to which certain amounts were credited by the School. This amount is included in Schedule J, Part II, Column C.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD HAS CREATED VARIOUS COMMITTEES TO PERFORM CERTAIN FUNCTIONS ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD. HOWEVER, THE COMMITTEES' ACTIONS ARE REVIEWED AND RATIFIED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THE HEADMASTER REVIEW FORM 990 AND APPROVE IT FOR FILING. the Form 990, except for Schedule B, is then provided to the full board prior to filing with the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each year the School sends to each officer, trustee, and key employee a questionnaire on any conflicts of interest. All other employees are made aware of the policy, and encouraged to disclose any conflicts.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE HEADMASTER AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. IT IS GENERALLY BASED ON A REVIEW OF COMPENSATION PACKAGES OFFERED BY SIMILAR SCHOOLS IN THE AREA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
